rationale: This course provides the knowledge necessary to develop dynamic web pages using Servlet, JSP, MVC web frameworks and hibernate. It covers the basic underlying concepts and techniques recently used in the IT industry. After going through this course students will be able to design MVC based Web applications.
competency: Develop MVC based web applications using Java web framework.

courseOutcomes.description: Develop a GUI application using swing components.
Apply ORM based Methodology for Application Development.
Develop Web Applications using Servlets and deploy in popular servers like Tomcat.
Develop JSP based applications with database connectivity.
Apply MVC architecture using Spring framework.

unitOutcomes.description: Develop GUI programs using Swing Components
Develop simple event driven programs using event class and event listener interface

topics.title: Introduction to JFC, AWT and Swing
Features of the Java Foundation Classes
Swing Components
subtopics: Commonly used Methods of Component class (add(), setSize(), setLayout(), and setVisible())
JApplet, JFrame, JLabel, JTextField, JTextArea, JButton, JCheckBox, JRadioButton, JComboBox, JMenu

unitOutcomes.description: Describe the basics of JDBC and its connectivity
Explain different types of JDBC drivers and their advantages and disadvantages
Develop program using JDBC to query a database and modify it
Explain Object Relational Mapping and Advantages
Describe Hibernate Architecture and Environment setup

topics.title: Two-Tier Database Design, Three-Tier Database Design
The JDBC API
subtopics: CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations using SQL

topics.title: ORM working model, advantages and ORM tools
Architecture of hibernate and installation steps for IDE

unitOutcomes.description: Develop web application using javax.servlet package

topics.title: The life cycle of a servlet
The Simple Servlet
subtopics: Create and compile servlet source code
Start a web browser and request the servlet
Example of echo servlet and deployment in tomcat server

topics.title: The javax.servlet Package
subtopics: Reading database/table records and displaying them using servlet

unitOutcomes.description: Explain JSP with syntax and Semantics
Implement web application using JSP Form input elements and validation
Implement web application using JSP Cookies and Session tracking
Describe JSTL - JSP STANDARD TAG LIBRARY
Implement web application using JSP database connection

topics.title: Advantages of JSP and lifecycle of JSP
Elements Created with the INPUT Tag, Elements Created with select and option, textarea Element
Read and Delete data from cookies, maintain session and track session id
Create Table using JSP, SELECT, INSERT, DELETE and UPDATE

unitOutcomes.description: Implement web application using Spring Framework
Describe Spring Boot and applications of Spring Boot

topics.title: Importance of MVC architecture, Advantages of MVC Architecture
Model layer, View layer and Controller layer
Aspect-oriented programming (AOP), Dependency injection (DI) and Plain Old Java Object (POJO)
Features in Spring Boot, Comparison Between Spring and Spring Boot

practicalExercises.description: Develop a GUI program by using one swing button and adding it on the JFrame object
Develop a program to create checkboxes for different courses belonging to a university such that the course selected would be displayed
Develop a program to Implement Traffic signal (Red, Green and Yellow) by using Swing components (Using JFrame, JRadioButton, ItemListener etc.)
Develop a program using JDBC to display student's record (Enroll No, Name, Address, Mobile No, and Email-ID) into table 'StuRec'
Develop a program using JDBC to edit (insert, update, delete) Student's profile stored in the database
Develop an application to store, update, fetch and delete data of Employee (NAME, AGE, SALARY and DEPARTMENT) using Hibernate CRUD operations
Develop a simple servlet program which maintains a counter for the number of times it has been accessed since its loading; initialize the counter using deployment descriptor
Create a web form which processes servlet and demonstrates use of cookies and sessions
Develop a web form which processes servlet for user login functionality
Develop a JSP web application to display student monthly attendance in each subject of current semester via enrollment number
Develop a JSP web application to select shopping products, buy any products and product billing page using session management
Develop a JSP program for student registration for new admission in college and display stored data it into admin dashboard
Develop a Web MVC Architecture based application to provide user Login and Register using Spring Boot

performanceIndicators.indicator: Testing and Debugging of the program

hardware: Computer system with operating system: Windows 7 or higher Ver., macOS, and Linux, with 4GB or higher RAM, Java, mysql
software: JDK and IDE such as eclipse, netbeans & spring framework

studentActivities: Explore different application development using java web application technologies/tools and frameworks
Give a seminar on any relevant topics
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/subtopics
'L' in section No. 4 means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature is to be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods
With respect to section No.11, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities
Guide students for open source java editors

microProjects.title: Degree/Diploma Admission Web Application
microProjects.description: Develop Degree/Diploma Admission web application using java web application technologies to get student registration data, process and filter data. Verification of submitted data. Support files/documents uploading features.

microProjects.title: Library Management System
microProjects.description: Develop Library Management System to update the record, monitor and add books, search for the required ones, taking care of the issue date and return date. It comes with basic features like creating a new record and updating and deleting it.

microProjects.title: College Placement Record Keeping System
microProjects.description: Develop MVC based web application for college placement record keeping. Student registration, apply for company. Find the result of the interview.

books.title: Beginning Hibernate 6
books.author: Joseph B. Ottinger, Jeff Linwood, Dave Minter

programOutcomes.description: Engineering practices for society, sustainability & environment
